title: A Practical Quantum Instruction Set Architecture

cells.data:
[Link to paper](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1608.03355.pdf)

_Goal_: Develop a hybrid classical / quantum architecture (the `Quantum Abstract Machine` or QAM) using an instruction language called `Quil` to form a Quantum Instruction Set Architecture.

_(|\( \Psi \)>, C, G, G', P, \( \kappa \))_ â€” this describes the state of the QAM at any moment, where \( \Psi \) is the state of a given qubit, C is classical memory, G and G' are static and parametric gates respectively, P is Quil instructions, and \( \kappa \) is a program counter for iterating through instructions.



A system with \(n\) bits has \( 2^n \) possible classical states, but a system with \(n\) qubits has a continuum of quantum states corresponding to various amplitude-weightings (superpositions) of the \( 2^n \) classical states.
